repnme.cdata!:
Yemen - Education for All Fast-Track
            Initiative Third Phase Catalytic Fund Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Education for All
            Fast-Track Initiative Third Phase Catalytic Fund Project for
            Yemen were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk
            to development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance
            was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: involving
            universities and civil society organizations will help to
            improve the quality of training while reducing teacher
            training costs. Universities will also provide accredited
            certificates, which is a further incentive to become a
            teacher. The MoE should initiate the necessary legislation
            for legally valid training diplomas and accredited degrees
            so teachers who choose to continue teaching can have
            something to build on for further academic studies. While
            general sectoral statements about all education projects
            under implementation provide important insights, it will
            have been clearer if the Third Party Monitoring (TPM)
            reports had completely disaggregated findings by project so
            that specific implementation issues could be more easily
            followed and specific outputs more easily tracked. The
            education sector had three World Bank-supervised projects
            under implementation simultaneously and it was sometimes
            difficult to distinguish between project-specific findings.
            Future phases or projects should devise and administer a
            simple learning test of students prior to and post-project
            implementation to see if there was any impact on learning
            levels after education quality interventions such as teacher
            training and distribution and use of school supply kits.

repnme.cdata!:
Yemen - Phase Three Education for All
            Fast-Track Initiative Catalytic Fund Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Phase
            Three Education for All Fast-Track Initiative Catalytic Fund
            Project is to increase access of children, especially girls,
            to primary education in seven underserved governorates. Due
            to the crisis in Yemen which led to an increase in prices
            and delays in implementation activities, the Republic of
            Yemen has requested certain changes. These changes include:
            extension of the closing date of the project; reallocation
            of the proceeds of grant; and changes to indicators and
            targets in the results framework. Due to the recent
            increases in prices, the remaining funds for construction
            for new and rehabilitated classrooms will cover 189 instead
            of 247 classrooms. In addition to the revised number of
            targeted classrooms, it is proposed to add one output
            indicator for the construction activities. This indicator is
            'the number of additional classrooms built or
            rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project
            intervention. Price increases have also affected the number
            of school kits that are able to be purchased under the
            project. The project closing date will be extended from
            September 30, 2012 to March 30, 2013. This is the first
            extension of closing date.
